title: How to choose safe and approved CBD product?
content:
Nowadays, CBD is being on its peak of popularity. It is presented in a wide range of products: oils, creams, lotions, vape liquids and edibles of all kinds. Due to its explosive popularity, it is being actively researched as a potential supplement or even a standalone treatment for certain issues. 

That’s all started from the [2018 farm bill](https://cbdspace.io/2018-farm-bill-and-what-it-means-for-cbd-industry/), that allowed to produce and sell hemp plant on the territory of the United States, but only if you are a licensed grower and the amount of THC in your plant does not exceed 0.3%. After that, CBD products flooded the stalls of your favorite markets and even CBD stores came in selling diversity of products. 

However, when it comes to choose a certain form or a CBD brand, you will probably face some serious questions that are going to need firm answers. So, basically, the subject of today’s discussion is how to choose safe and approved CBD product without any accidents. First things first, let’s determine all the commons connected with CBD!

## What does CBD mean and how it works?

Generally speaking, CBD is one of the major compounds found in cannabis plant, and the CBD abbreviation stands short for cannabidiol. Unlike his nearest cousin THC, which is the primary compound of \[Tooltip]cannabis\[Tooltip], and is responsible for most of the psychoactivity of the plant. 

Simply put, CBD cannot get you to the “high” state no matter how much you use, it is just impossible, because it works differently. Furthermore, CBD is usually extracted from the hemp plant, and the amount of THC in it is quite small, so there is no way you can get accidentally high from it. So, if CBD is quite similar to THC, why it works other way? That’s a good question! Let’s get to the point of how does CBD work.

Every one of us has its own endocannabinoid system(ECS), which is a complex of receptors giving signals to our body and produces cannabinoids to maintain \[Tooltips]homeostasis\[Tooltip] and our overall wellness. The ECS is responsible for regulation of many functions in our body: immunity, mood, memory, appetite, etc. For example, the thing known as “runner’s high” is a result of working ECS. 

Endocannabinoid system has receptors, that either CBD or THC interact with, CB1 and CB2. Unlike THC, CBD due to its shape doesn’t try to replace our natural \[Tooltip]neurotransmitters\[Tooltip] called anandamide, but just binds to these receptors producing much more cannabinoids to maintain our natural body rhythms. The exact ways of how CB1 and CB2 receptors affect on our brains isn’t fully understood so there are still more to study and research. Before heading to shopping for CBD, we should understand fully the benefits and uses of CBD in general.

### Uses, benefits and side effects of CBD.

To the moment, there are plenty researches claiming high therapeutic potential of CBD. It is claimed, that it might become a good supplement or even a standalone treatment to some conditions, such as insomnia, depression, anxiety, acne, severe kinds of pain, heart-related issues, and more. There are also some experiments claiming that CBD should be useful in helping with drug addictions and \[Tooltip]withdrawal\[Tooltip]. 

However, not all the benefits are presented with strict evidence, but CBD in general gives positive results, and it is only a matter of time before we will see more studies. Scientists claim that CBD is completely safe in its pure state so it is not likely to cause any damage. However, there are still some temporary side effects you should be aware of: fatigue, nausea, diarrhea and several mood and weight changes. 

These sides are not so crucial and it is more individual, than common problem. What’s more important, that CBD may [interact](https://cbdspace.io/cbd-and-drug-interactions-is-it-dangerous/) with your daily medication and you should be pretty careful in case of your own health and wellness. Now let’s talk a bit about forms of CBD and how you can use it in general. There are four primary methods:

### Sublingual.

It is the most popular form of CBD at the moment. Generally speaking, it is the most common [way](https://cbdspace.io/what-is-sublingual-cbd-an-essential-guide/) to use CBD. Both oils and tinctures are taken via a dropper under your tongue. It holds there around a minute so that CBD could easily get in your bloodstream through the little capillaries. It lasts for about 2-4 hours, is quite easy to use and control your dosage. 

This method’s absorption speed and long-lasting activity makes it pretty effective and that’s why it is so popular among other forms of usage. Mostly, all these tinctures are made of CBD and oils like coconut or hemp seed oil. They may also contain other ingredients such as some additional flavors, vinegar, ethanol, etc. If you look for a quick and easy results - this one is totally your way to use CBD.

### Edibles.

There are various types of food and drinks infused with CBD that can be easily purchased and used on a daily basis(for example, gummies infused with CBD, or a water). Moreover, capsules and pills can be added to your meals and also be effective. 

It is a straightforward and discreet [way](https://cbdspace.io/cbd-edibles-an-essential-guide/) to use CBD, because edibles are being digested in your stomach to get to the bloodstream. Scientists talk about “first pass effect”<sup id="ref_1">[1](#note_1)</sup>, it means that part of digested CBD is being broken before taking an action, that’s why this method isn’t as popular as sublingual.

### Inhalation

This form allows you to absorb CBD through your lungs by breathing. It’s rather efficient [way](https://cbdspace.io/vaping-cbd-oil-an-essential-guide/) to use CBD and by the way, smoking has always been main method to use cannabis. Nowadays, CBD mostly taken safeway, by vaping liquids from a special device known as \[Tooltip]vape pen\[Tooltip]. 

The main advantage is that the CBD’s effect can be felt almost immediately by vaping, so it is fantastic for people who are in need of immediate relief, because the absorption rate of this method is quite similar or sometimes even bigger than the sublingual type. People state that it is the most enjoyable and convenient way to use CBD, because you can use different flavors and take it pretty much everywhere you want, due to vapes handy properties. Unfortunately, it’s effects last for a short period, something around an hour, so it is a main weakness of this method. 

### Topical.

It is believed, that CBD-infused creams and lotions are able to relieve muscle, arthritis pain and direct inflammation. The last major [method](https://cbdspace.io/what-are-cbd-topicals-an-essential-guide/) of using CBD is applying it directly to skin via cream, lotion or an oil. These products interact with endocannabinoid receptors under your skin instead of bloodstream and that makes it rather beneficial for targeted pain issues like arthritis or inflammation.

So, there are a lot of ways to consume your CBD, but before buying anything, you should know how to choose whatever CBD and why should you be wise while shopping for it.

### Why should you be wise while shopping for CBD?

It is not a secret that CBD is quite popular thing and the variety of products available for consumers on the market is marvellous, but here come some issues. All these products are not regulated enough, because Food and Drug Administration of the United States is still making their decisions and testing CBD. Meanwhile, the market is flooded with various CBD products, that possibly came from an unlicensed growers and can cause serious troubles for a common consumer. 

Mislabeling, fake products and much more can affect your daily life and health. That’s why you should be wise while purchasing any CBD product. We understand that it is hard to check everything, but that’s your own personal health, and you must pay attention to it. So, we finally get to the point of choosing safe and legit product and in our next paragraph we are going to share with you some primary tips and advice you may follow while hunting for CBD.

### How to choose your safe and legal CBD product?

When it comes to choosing products, you must always be wise and careful, because the mistakes may cost you health. Here we want to give you some personal advice to your CBD market discovery:

* Legality status: First of all, check state and federal laws of your area. Even if you know, that CBD is safe and legal, your area’s laws can still prohibit growing or using CBD. Fortunately, on the territory of the United States it is almost legal, but check this information just to be verified, it should be very easy to access.
* CBD reviews: Do not get reviews and words as a truth in a first instance. Many of reviews might be commercial and just promoting their products. So, it is not something that you must listen to, but reading some people’s personal reviews can be a good idea if you want to know how this or that CBD product feels like.
* Marketing: As we have mentioned before, do not believe every ad. The industry of CBD is on its peak right now, and for some people it means money. Marketers don’t care about your health and wellness, it’s just their job. Sometimes low promoted product might be a better idea than using one that’s being advertised over and over on the TV, web, etc. So be sure you are not being influenced by a marketing strategy, use your own knowledge and the help of professionals.
* Magical properties: Beware of brands that claim CBD unbelievable properties. For example, one brand may say that their product can cure cancer. Of course, it can’t, they’re just juggling some researches saying that CBD might be helpful with relieving chemotherapy pains or other side effects. There are no strict claims that CBD is a standalone cure-all treatment, that’s why we try to use official resources while sharing with you scientific information on CBD.
* Certification: Any CBD product should be approved by a document known as COA, it shows that lab tested and checked for the \[Tooltip]potency\[Tooltip]. Moreover, the batch number of COA should match the one on the label. All this information on the product should be easily found according to the local and state laws, it should make your choice more verified on a certain product.
* Testing: Any tests on a CBD products must meet with"ISO 17025"standards and also be validated with one of the official regulatory organizations:U.S. Pharmacopeia, Association of Official Agricultural Chemists, or the American Herbal Pharmacopoeia.
* Where the hemp comes from?: You should always check, that the hemp was produced by a licensed grower on the territory of the United States and fits all the agriculture laws, that will totally help you find the right product that might fulfill all your demands.
* Questioning: Do not be afraid of asking questions directly to companies if they provide some contacts. If you are deciding whether to buy a certain brand’s product, just contact their support and ask for any information you are interested in. If their answers don’t satisfy you, just go and try other, there are many other brands on the market. This is not a complete list, but some useful tips for you. Be concerned of what you buy and the job of choosing right CBD product won’t be that complicated.

Go visit your doctor instead of reading this! Everything we list here is just a personal opinion of our team based on some scientific researches and studies available free on the web. It means, that as any information you will find, with the exception of studies, is not a truth itself in a first instance. 

Before making any decisions we strongly recommend you visiting doctor or pharmacist, because professionals are betters assistants for your health. Even if your doctor doesn’t know CBD fully, he can give you some instructions and direct to safe and approved companies, that provide CBD products. Furthermore, only a professional can say, how exactly CBD can interact with your daily medication. So, don’t take untrusted information at face value.

#### Bottom line.

As it is said before, we share with just our team’s personal opinion and thoughts, based on some studies. It is done for you in order to help and not spending that much time on investigation and attempts to get a truthful information. It is only your concern on whether to use CBD. Always believe professionals and avoid untrusted products. We hope that these articles come in handy for you and glad if you are reading this. Stay tuned for more useful articles and guides, and don’t forget to share\*\*
